|brand = Amazon |model = Dash Button |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = 2 Gen (JK29LP) |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 04/23/2019 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Amazon_Dash_Button_2_Gen_(JK29LP) |wlclass = N150 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = IoT |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = 2AETK-1013 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Atmel;ATSAMG55J; |cpu1_cores = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |cpu1_type = <!-- ARM,MIPS,x86-64,PowerPC, --> |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = <!-- undocumented --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Micron;N25Q032; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = |ram1chip = |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_none = true |oui = 44:65:0D,74:C2:46,74:75:48
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 1.5 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = battery powered
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = <!-- default Login Name, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 03/29/2016 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B075FPHHGG |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = |rad1modif = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atmel;ATWINC1500B; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->

==Overview== *[https://mpetroff.net/2016/07/new-amazon-dash-button-teardown-jk29lp/ ''Amazon Dash Button Teardown'' from '''Matthew Petroff'''] *[https://adelectronics.ru/2018/02/10/обзор-rak611-iot-dash-button-ч-1-схемотехника-и-первые-вп/ ''IoT Dash Button Teardown'' on '''AD|Electronics'''] *[https://github.com/dekuNukem/Amazon_Dash_Button ''Amazon Dash Button'' on '''GitHub'''] (spec.)
==See also== *[[Amazon Dash Button 1 Gen (JK76PL)]] - [https://mpetroff.net/2015/05/amazon-dash-button-teardown/ Teardown] • [https://www.amazon.com/b/?node=10667898011 PPage] :FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/2ACBE-0610 2ACBE-0610] (2015-03-25) - JK76PL (REV 01) *[[Amazon Dash Button 2 Gen (JK29LP)]] - [https://mpetroff.net/2016/07/new-amazon-dash-button-teardown-jk29lp/ Teardown] • [https://github.com/dekuNukem/Amazon_Dash_Button/tree/master/rev2 images] :FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/2AETK-1013 2AETK-1013] (2016-03-29) - JK29LP (REV 02) *[[Amazon Dash Wand 1 Gen (OR83YV)]] - [https://mpetroff.net/2016/09/amazon-dash-wand-teardown/ Teardown] :FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/2ABD7-5363 2ABD7-5363] (2014-03-20) *[[Amazon Dash Wand 2 Gen (PL46MN)]] - [https://mpetroff.net/2016/12/second-generation-amazon-dash-wand-teardown/ Teardown] :FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/2AETI-0610 2AETI-0610] (2016-09-14)
